Type.Name: WebClient

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi WebClient extends System.ComponentModel.Component

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Provides common methods for sending data to and receiving data from a resource identified by a URI.

block.para: The class provides common methods for sending data to or receiving data from any local, Intranet, or Internet resource identified by a URI.
The class uses the class to provide access to Internet resources. instances can access data with any class derived from that is registered with the method.
By default, the CLI supports URIs with the "http:", "https:", and "file:" schemes.
The class provides the following methods for uploading data to a resource.

item.term: sends a to the server hosting a resource.
sends a byte array to the server hosting a resource and returns a byte array containing the response from the server, if any.
sends a local file to the server hosting a resource and returns a byte array containing the response from the server, if any.
sends a collection to the server hosting a resource and returns a byte array containing the response from the server, if any.

block.para: The class also provides the following methods for downloading data from a resource.

item.term: downloads data from a resource and returns a byte array.
downloads data from a resource to a local file.
returns the data from the resource as a .

summary.para: Downloads data from the resource identified by the specified URI, and writes the data to the specified file .

remarks.para: If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .
This method downloads data from the absolute URI to local file, . If already exists, the existing file is overwritten.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.
is or or contains invalid characters, or the specified path to the file does not exist.
An error occurred while downloading data.

Docs.exception: The caller does not have permission to write to local files.
Docs.permission: Requires permission to write to files. See .

summary.para: Opens a readable containing the data downloaded from the resource identified by the specified URI.

returns.para: A used to read data from a resource.

remarks.para: If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .

para.block: This method creates a instance used to access the data specified by the absolute URI The caller of this method is responsible for calling to release the resources allocated for the stream.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.
An error occurred while downloading data.

summary.para: Opens a for writing data to the resource identified by the specified URI.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to (, "POST").

If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .

para.block: The underlying request is made with the POST method.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.

summary.para: Opens a for writing data to the resource identified by the specified URI using the specified protocol method.

returns.para: A used to write data to the resource.

remarks.para: If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .

block.para: This method returns a writable stream that is used to send data to a resource. The underlying request is made with the protocol method specified by . For more information about protocol methods, see .

If the parameter specifies a method that is not recognized by the server, the underlying protocol classes determine what occurs. Typically, a
is thrown with the property set to indicate the error.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.
An error occurred while opening the stream.

Docs.param: A that specifies the URI of the resource to receive the data.
A array containing data to send to the resource.

summary.para: Uploads the specified data to the resource identified by the specified URI.

returns.para: A array containing the body of the response, if any, from the server hosting the resource.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to (, "POST", ).

If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .

block.para: This method sends a data buffer to a resource. The underlying request is made using the POST method.
This method does not encode the contents of before uploading it to the resource.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.
An error occurred while opening the stream or uploading the data.
There was no response from the server hosting the resource.

Docs.param: A that specifies the URI of the resource to receive the collection .
The to send to the resource identified by .

summary.para: Uploads the specified name/value collection to the specified resource.

returns.para: A array containing the body of the response, if any, from the server hosting the resource.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to (, "POST", ).
If the Content-Type header is , this method sets it to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".

If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .

para.block: The underlying request is made using the POST method.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.
An error occurred while opening the stream or uploading the data.
There was no response from the server hosting the resource.
The Content-Type header is not , and is not "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".

returns.para: A array containing the body of the response, if any, from the server hosting the resource.

remarks.para: If the Content-Type header is , this method sets it to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".

If the property of the current instance is not , is combined with to form the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is , is required to be the absolute URI of the requested data. If the property of the current instance is not , it is appended to .

para.block: If specifies a protocol method that is not recognized by the server, the underlying protocol classes determine what occurs. Typically, a is thrown with the property set to indicate the error.

exception.para: The absolute URI is not valid.
An error occurred while opening the stream or uploading the data.
There was no response from the server hosting the resource.
The Content-Type header is not , and is not "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".
